channel.title: Fuzzy tv
channel.description:
this was done 100% by me (yay my second photoshop tut)
make a new background then make it white now click the T thing and then choose which Font you want i'll be using "Snap ITC" and then make the font color black now keep on doing lines of zero's when you're done doing the lines it'll look somthing like this: [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img141.imageshack.us/img141/4421/untitled1tu8.png[/img][/URL] now click on one of the text things and then Filter > Blur > Radial Blur and change the stuff in there to this [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img184.imageshack.us/img184/9578/untitled1eu2.png[/img][/URL] do that to every line so now it'll look like this [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img178.imageshack.us/img178/1935/blurredwg1.png[/img][/URL] now go to filter > Stylize > Find Edges on all of the lines and then it should look like this: [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img307.imageshack.us/img307/753/edgesfoundxa4.png[/img][/URL] now Filter > Stylize > Glowing Edges and leave it default settings, do it on all the lines and stwice on some so it goes colory(only 2 or 3) so it'll look like this: [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img157.imageshack.us/img157/8758/fuzzynowte3.png[/img][/URL]
this part is optional now if you want we're going to make it animate like a real fuzzy tv now click Window > Animation and then go down to the animation bit click the little arrow in the circle then click "next frame" right click 3 of the lines of 0 then click "blending options" and make the opacity 70 on them, then click "next frame" again and make 2 of the lines you made 70 100 again and then make 2 more line from the other side 70 and do something like that again then edit in imageready and then click file > save optimised as then host it and you'll get something like this: [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img97.imageshack.us/img97/9748/untitled1kh4.gif[/img][/URL]

item.title: Fuzzy tv
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

usernamelol:

and ie dont just need gif.

I gave an IE version because IE6 doesn’t support png transparency.

usernamelol:

Gif is better quality.

LOL. GIF IS BETTER QUALITY THAN PNG? LOLOLOLOLOLOLOLOL

First of all, right click each image and you’ll see that the png is 32bits and the gif is 8bits.
Second of all, gif supports a maximum of 256 colors, while png’s color palatte is limitless.

Read full topic

item.title: Fuzzy tv
item.dc:creator: @usernamelol .Fusion
item.description:
@usernamelol wrote:

[quote=“Rictoo, post:5, topic:36763”]My version:

  1. Open paint and make an average sized canvas
  2. Make a big blue rectangle
  3. Get a TV off images.google.com
  4. Skew the blue rectangle until it fits the TV screen
  5. Voila! A sexy TV!

Finished Product:
- and for pussy IE users, a gif version: [/quote]
ROFL Nice tv but thats not fuzzy, and ie dont just need gif. Gif is better quality.

Read full topic

item.title: Fuzzy tv
item.dc:creator: @dark_child dark_child
item.description:
@dark_child wrote:

this was done 100% by me (yay my second photoshop tut)

make a new background then make it white
now click the T thing and then choose which Font you want i’ll be using “Snap ITC” and then make the font color black
now keep on doing lines of zero’s when you’re done doing the lines it’ll look somthing like this:

now click on one of the text things and then Filter > Blur > Radial Blur and change the stuff in there to this

do that to every line so now it’ll look like this

now go to filter > Stylize > Find Edges on all of the lines and then it should look like this:

now Filter > Stylize > Glowing Edges and leave it default settings, do it on all the lines and stwice on some so it goes colory(only 2 or 3)
so it’ll look like this:

this part is optional
now if you want we’re going to make it animate like a real fuzzy tv
now click Window > Animation and then go down to the animation bit click the little arrow in the circle then click “next frame”
right click 3 of the lines of 0 then click “blending options” and make the opacity 70 on them, then click “next frame” again and make 2 of the lines you made 70 100 again and then make 2 more line from the other side 70 and do something like that again then edit in imageready and then click file > save optimised as then host it and you’ll get something like this:

Read full topic
